Subject: Re: [junit] ClassLoader constraints violation
From: john prince <johnprince@...>

Hi,

I ran up against this problem as well. After reading the 3.5 release notes (I must really have been desperate!), I worked out that it goes away if you use the -noloading parameter when running JUnit, i.e. <package>.TestRunner -noloading package.Class

John

> "Rupert" <rupert@...> wrote:
> > Anyone shed any light on this? I can run the associated code against
> > java, but not through the TestRunner...
> >
> > java.lang.LinkageError: Class org/w3c/dom/Element violates loader
> > constraints
> >         at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass0(Native Method)
> >         at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java,
> > Compiled Code)
> >         at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java:427)
> >         at junit.runner.TestCaseClassLoader.loadClass
> > (TestCaseClassLoader.java, Compiled Code)...
> 
> I recently had a similar problem. I decided that it was a classloader problem
> (somewhat obvious I guess) and so I excluded the jar file that was causing me
> the problems from the classloader by copying the "excluded.properties" file
> from the src folder and putting it in a folder in my classpath. That solved
> the problem.
> 
> (I created a "properties" directory and put its path in my classpath (before
> junit.jar), and then created a "junit" dir inside "properties" and a "runner"
> dir inside "junit" and put the properties file in there. That's the only way
> it will work (AFAIK).)
> 
> 
> Erik
> 
> 
> 
>
